btQuaternion Class Reference

The btQuaternion implements quaternion to perform linear algebra rotations in combination with btMatrix3x3, btVector3 and btTransform. More...

#include <btQuaternion.h>

Detailed Description

The btQuaternion implements quaternion to perform linear algebra rotations in combination with btMatrix3x3, btVector3 and btTransform.

Definition at line 55 of file btQuaternion.h.

Here is the call graph for this function:

btQuaternion btQuaternion::slerp ( const btQuaternion &  q,
const btScalar &  t 
) const [inline]

Return the quaternion which is the result of Spherical Linear Interpolation between this and the other quaternion.

Parameters:
q The other quaternion to interpolate with
t The ratio between this and q to interpolate. If t = 0 the result is this, if t=1 the result is q. Slerp interpolates assuming constant velocity.

Definition at line 563 of file btQuaternion.h.

References btQuaternion(), dot(), length2(), and glm::sign().

00564         {
00565 
00566                 const btScalar magnitude = btSqrt(length2() * q.length2());
00567                 btAssert(magnitude > btScalar(0));
00568                 
00569                 const btScalar product = dot(q) / magnitude;
00570                 const btScalar absproduct = btFabs(product);
00571                 
00572                 if(absproduct < btScalar(1.0 - SIMD_EPSILON))
00573                 {
00574                         // Take care of long angle case see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slerp
00575                         const btScalar theta = btAcos(absproduct);
00576                         const btScalar d = btSin(theta);
00577                         btAssert(d > btScalar(0));
00578                         
00579                         const btScalar sign = (product < 0) ? btScalar(-1) : btScalar(1);
00580                         const btScalar s0 = btSin((btScalar(1.0) - t) * theta) / d;
00581                         const btScalar s1 = btSin(sign * t * theta) / d;
00582                         
00583                         return btQuaternion(
00584                                 (m_floats[0] * s0 + q.x() * s1),
00585                                 (m_floats[1] * s0 + q.y() * s1),
00586                                 (m_floats[2] * s0 + q.z() * s1),
00587                                 (m_floats[3] * s0 + q.w() * s1));
00588                 }
00589                 else
00590                 {
00591                         return *this;
00592                 }
00593         }
